sentence: Looking at options trading activity among components of the Russell 3000 index, there is noteworthy activity today in Procter & Gamble Co. (Symbol: PG), where a total volume of 42,827 contracts has been traded thus far today, a contract volume which is representative of approximately 4.3 million underlying shares (given that every 1 contract represents 100 underlying shares).
That number works out to 62.5% of PG's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 6.9 million shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $87.50 strike call option expiring April 21, 2017 , with 7,760 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 776,000 underlying shares of PG.

Below is a chart showing PG's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $87.50 strike highlighted in orange:

GNC Holdings Inc (Symbol: GNC) saw options trading volume of 18,442 contracts, representing approximately 1.8 million underlying shares or approximately 59.2% of GNC's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 3.1 million shares.
Particularly high volume was seen for the $10 strike call option expiring April 21, 2017 , with 3,821 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 382,100 underlying shares of GNC.

Below is a chart showing GNC's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $10 strike highlighted in orange:

And 3D Systems Corp. (Symbol: DDD) saw options trading volume of 9,823 contracts, representing approximately 982,300 underlying shares or approximately 56.7% of DDD's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 1.7 million shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $15.50 strike call option expiring April 21, 2017 , with 1,620 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 162,000 underlying shares of DDD.

Below is a chart showing DDD's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $15.50 strike highlighted in orange:
